reviewText: Worthless.  Not involved enough for any onE who does not know paper piecing her way.  Really sad.  I do paper piecing and this dvd dies nothing at all to help me.  A water of my money.  To think I purchased the dvd and book.  So sad.
Good DVD, but wish I had the book for back referencing..

Peggy takes her time teaching you to paper piece......no rushing through it!!
I also puchased her CD, which also teaches you to chain piece the paper piecing to several designs! I am so thrilled I got this book and the CD!!

This is such a breakthru for me.
Peggy makes it so simple and fast.
I just LOVE this technique.
Wonderful Teacher.
I hadn't bought an instructional dvd before, so this was a pleasant surprise. I have quilted for years, but never done paper piecing. I wish this had had more than 2 templates, though.

Let's face it, most paper piecing patterns are full of angles that make guessing impossible, so trial and error or checking and rechecking or ripping out and starting over are a part of the process. This turned me off in the past. Peggy's patterns are clearly marked and using her strip-piecing method together with them eliminates the guess work and elimiates steps making it a faster process. Some checking is required, but no more than on regular piecing as the 1/4 inch seam allowance still applies. Peggy covered every single question I thought and repeated her answers when the situation arised during the instructional part of the DVD. Two patterns she demonstrates are included (as downloads) with the DVD.
